displaytitle: Intaglio gem with angel in relief
medium: Yellow-brown glass set in silver mounting
dimensions: 2.6 x 1.9 x 0.7 cm (1 x 3/4 x 1/4 in.) (in setting)
creditline: Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr.

titles.title: Intaglio gem with angel in relief

texts.textentryhtml: Acquired by Frank Jewett Mather, Jr., at at unknown date from an unknown source; given to the Museum in 1940 by Mather.

bibliography.boilertext: Dorothy Eugenia Miner, Early Christian and Byzantine art: an exhibition held at The Baltimore Museum of Art, (Baltimore, MD: Baltimore Museum of Art, 1947).
bibliography.citation: Dorothy Eugenia Miner, Early Christian and Byzantine art: an exhibition held at The Baltimore Museum of Art, (Baltimore, MD: Baltimore Museum of Art, 1947)., p. 116; no. 573

bibliography.boilertext: Slobodan Curcic and Archer St. Clair, Byzantium at Princeton: Byzantine art and archaeology at Princeton University: catalogue of an exhibition at Firestone Library, Princeton University, August 1 through October 26, 1986, (Princeton, NJ: Dept. of Art and Archaeology, Princeton University, The Art Museum, Princeton University, Princeton University Library, Dept. of Rare Books and Special Collections, 1986).
bibliography.citation: Slobodan Curcic and Archer St. Clair, Byzantium at Princeton: Byzantine art and archaeology at Princeton University: catalogue of an exhibition at Firestone Library, Princeton University, August 1 through October 26, 1986, (Princeton, NJ: Dept. of Art and Archaeology, Princeton University, The Art Museum, Princeton University, Princeton University Library, Dept. of Rare Books and Special Collections, 1986)., cat. no. 130; p. 111

caption: Byzantine, late 5th–early 6th century, Intaglio gem with angel in relief. Yellow-brown glass set in silver mounting; 2.6 x 1.9 x 0.7 cm (in setting). Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr. (y1940-393)
